attributes.action: The Government should add Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) to the DWP's list of Disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
The DWP does not recognise Post Traumatic Stress Disorder [PTSD] as a Disability for the purpose of Assessments.  In the light of recent high profile cases the Government should address this failure of duty of care to Victims.

The Government should therefore:

•      Acknowledge the effects of severe trauma on serving military personnel .
•	Recognise that victims of Child Abuse, whether sexual, emotional or physical , has profound and long lasting traumatic effect on victims lives, which may not present themselves until later in life.
•	Recognise the effects on Adults and Child Survivors of witnessing  traumatic events , both man-made and natural disasters (Hillsborough, Bombings,  Murder of a relative, Tsunami , Earthquakes. )

The Government should instruct the DWP and Dept of Health to add PTSD to its list of Disabilities for the purpose of assessment by internal and external departments. [Atos, Work Programmes]
